intro: Tricostularia lepschii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Tricostularia lepschii is popular in horticulture for its ability to bloom continuously under proper care.
